result.execSummary:
The defendant Deborah K. Beaupre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty fees to be determined--Def must continue to pay $50/month as previously ordered until paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Order for Payment of Fees

Defendant Deborah K. Beaupre in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bob Majewski from MCJ in court. Dr. Jenny Leach appears by phone. Attorney Doug Knott appears by phone.
8:31am
Court is being heard on motion
ADA spks- statute reads Court cannot order def to be placed on GPS monitoring. Jail will not know what medications def will be administered until she arrives at the jail and starts serving sentence
Dr. Leach spks on process
Atty Crowell spks on medications
Court orders def's report date be changed to 2-2-17 at 7am--when the Dr will be at the jail
Court orders JOC be modified to reflect date change
to require the furnishing & administration of def's prescribed medications
to require the furnishing & administration of def's prescribed medications
letter from Atty Crowell re:  medications
letter from Atty Crowell with attachments re: medical

11:29am
ADA spks on agreement
Court arraigns def
Def pleads n/c
Plea quest/WOR
Fact basis
Court finds def guilty
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Crowell spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes:
25 days jail with good time and huber release, if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. 1 day credit. Report to jail by 7pm on 1-31-17.Atty Crowell to meet with jail staff to ensure def can take required medication. If not, def will have to be placed on GPS monitor.
Remit fines and costs
Atty Fees to be determined---  Def must continue to pay $50/month as previously ordered until paid in full
Def must give DNA sample by 1-31-17
Appeal rights
